name: reinterment
content:
Add to word list
Add to word list
the act of burying a dead body again after it has been removed from the ground where it was buried: Her family has now released her body for reinterment. They had to find an appropriate burial site and make arrangements for re-interment. The reinterments were all accompanied by religious services. Related words
interment
reinter
More examplesFewer examplesThe state authorities consulted with tribal leaders about a suitable location for the re-interment of the remains.The developer has removed the remains found on the site and is holding them for reinterment later.The reinterment is scheduled for the last week in October.
